byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo. Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

abstract: News Analysis; United States support for Saudi-led military campaign against Houthi rebels in Yemen comes at cost of escalating regional fight with Iran, which backs Houthis; while US and Iran are at loggerheads in Yemen, they are de facto allies in fight against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; situation highlights what some see as puzzling patchwork of Middle East policies by Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: In becoming involved in a Saudi-led campaign to dislodge rebels in Yemen, the United States has created more entanglement with its alliances.

headline.main: A Policy Puzzle of U.S. Goals and Alliances in the Middle East

snippet: In becoming involved in a Saudi-led campaign to dislodge rebels in Yemen, the United States has created more entanglement with its alliances.
